availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John M. Pickering (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer )

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas W. Pickering and Minerva Cook Pickering. Married to Josephine Rogers Pickering. Student in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Princeton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 377A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 799
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 31.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File #10344.
"John Minnus Pickering (1838-1930)," Find A Grave, Memorial #203675150, accessed December 9, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/203675150.
